title: Uber plans smart scooters that automatically brake to avoid accidents
text:
Uber is working on robotic scooters which could brake for riders and warn of obstacles ahead.

The company says it is working to develop scooters that can detect when a rider is breaking local laws by riding on a pavement.

After that it would plan to introduce driver-assist systems similar to those seen in cars, which could warn someone of upcoming obstacles and even brake for them.

Uber, which started offering electric bicycles and scooters after buying the startup Jump in 2018, is one of several companies working to develop the technology, which it hopes will make regulators more amenable to allowing the schemes in their cities.
